title: Facebook Screenshot Notifications Explained: Posts, Messages, + More

steps.title: Taking a screenshot of stories, posts, or pictures does not send a notification.
steps.content: Taking a screenshot of stories, posts, or pictures does not send a notification. You or someone else can take screenshots of almost anything without triggering a notification. [1] X Research source

steps.title: A screenshot of an encrypted chat will send a notification.
steps.content: A screenshot of an encrypted chat will send a notification. Encrypted chats will disappear after a designated time, and if someone turns that feature on, then Facebook will send a notification when someone screenshots a message. [2] X Research source

steps.title: You'll see a line in the chat that someone took a screenshot.
steps.content: You'll see a line in the chat that someone took a screenshot. The profile that took the screenshot will be mentioned in the chat, so there's no hiding who took the picture. You can forward the encrypted message too, by tapping and holding the message until a menu pops up. If you do this, though, you'll see a "[Your Name] forwarded a message" notification in the chat. [3] X Research source
